samples.question: And is family important in your country?
samples.transcript: Well, I am intrigued by this question of whether we could evolve and develop an innovative way of, developing, the friendship that we have. Now, as specifically regarding the family members, of course it does have an important role when it comes to the people that you have in your family. I do accept this as true that, their relationship between the family members are so important that they should be close-knit together. that is something that I think it should be happened most of the time.

samples.question: What is your favorite sport?
samples.transcript: Well, in terms of watching sports, I like to watch soccer, soccer match. But when it comes to playing, I would love to play ping-pong. You know, it is, it is like a sport that I like it the most because it is very challenging whenever you are just, providing the play and, with, with your friend, for example. it is like, a very pleasant moment for me whenever I am just playing ping-pong with my friends. Specifically because of the techniques that I have used, the tips, tricks, strategies that I actually performed using the game that I have learned for less than eight hours, eight years. I do believe that it is such a game that I love it the most. that is wonderful.

samples.question: And do you play, did you play sports as a child?
samples.transcript: Absolutely, yeah. I can vividly remember a time that I was like nine years old. It was the first time that I was about to, get a racket off the ping pong, but it was very difficult for me, but I gave up at that time. sooner or later, I tried myself to be a better player and, you know, if I had, played more, I would have been more successful. Days after days after some increasing, the abilities and enhancing and promoting my abilities, I came up to this idea that pinpoint is not that much difficult that I used to think. So slowly I learned so many techniques, tips, tricks, and strategies as well. And then, I grew up, and I do not want to say that I am a professional ping pong player, but at least I know some few things, to, to provide a show off. All right. Brilliant. All right.

samples.question: Why is it good to discuss problems with others?
samples.transcript: Well, that is a tough question, of course, but when it comes to talk about talking to people that, you know, of course, you trust, I think when you are talking to a friend of you that you trust the most, that problem will be scrutinized in details and elaborations as if that you can actually find so many great solutions to the problem. And, and that way you can actually find a great solution as well as come up with the best ideas that you can provide for that problem that you have. So I, I do accept this is true that sometimes it is necessary for us to hear our own voice, but some other times, however, we need to actually consult with the people whom are proficient in the field that are scholars in the field and are technical, of course, in terms of being practical. Practical and theoretical. I think it is important to and significant to discuss and mention the problem that we have with our friends and with our relatives as well as the people that we trust. Great.

samples.question: And do you think that it is better to talk to friends and not family about problems?
samples.transcript: Well, this is such a challenging question of course, but, friends are friends, families are families. I think some of the things should be shared with the family members. For example, I can mention, for example, if, if you are in, in terms of budget, if, you do not have money, for example, for instance, you need to, consult with your family members. Of course, your father and your mother, I am talking about the parents, are the people that you can trust the most and also you can, borrow, the money that you can trust. That you need from the family members.

samples.question: And is it always a good idea to tell lots of people about a problem?
samples.transcript: People get frustrated when we talk a lot about the problem. And of course, when it comes to over-talking, people maybe do not have that ears to, to listen for us. So, listen to us. So I do believe that we should actually take a look at how people, edit, how people's attitude are and, how people's attitude is and, the way, the way that they are actually having manner and also how they, they, they tolerate us and how they, they want it to be a sounding board to us or not. So it does have an important role. Nevertheless, some people may talk to their friends and also some other people regarding the problems that they have, regarding the difficulties, regarding the suffering points that they have in their lives. But I believe that we should actually handle most of the challenges that we face and confront. Right, good. And let us now talk about communication skills at work.

samples.question: Do you enjoy shopping?
samples.transcript: I love shopping, yeah. As a woman, most of the time, I prefer to spend my free time shopping, shopping centres, of course. OK.
samples.transcript_original: I love shopping, yeah. As a woman, most of the time, I prefer to spend my free time shopping, shopping centres, of course. OK.

samples.question: And how often do you go shopping, and what do you buy?
samples.transcript: Most of the time, at weekends, with my friends, and I prefer to buy clothes, especially shoes and cosmetics.
samples.transcript_original: Most of the time, at weekends, with my friends, and I prefer to buy clothes, especially shoes and cosmetics.
samples.transcript_cleaned: Most of the time, at weekends, with my friends, and I prefer to buy clothes, especially shoes and cosmetics.

samples.question: So, do you prefer to go shopping alone or with other people and why?
samples.transcript: It depends. I am a person who buys other things easily. But if, I do not know, my friends are really picky and streaky, okay, I prefer to do it alone by myself. Okay, I would like to move on and ask you some questions about food.

samples.question: What is your favourite food and why?
